channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SPR-2854] spring should not throw IllegalStateException if begin a transaction fail
item.description:
when use HibernateTransactionManager manage hibernate transaction
if begin a transaction fail it would not throw a IllegalStateException

org.springframework.transaction.CannotCreateTransactionException: Could not open Hibernate Session for transaction; nested exception is org.hibernate.TransactionException: JDBC begin failed:
Caused by:

item.summary: spring should not throw IllegalStateException if begin a transaction fail

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
This has fortunately already been discovered and fixed (at least if I analyzed your stacktraces correctly). Feel free to give a recent 2.0.1 snapshot a try (http://www.springframework.org/snapshots)!

FYI, Spring 2.0.1 is about to be released within the next 24 hours. It would still be good if you could give a snapshot a try to verify that it works for you...

Juergen
